etymologies: from Arabic, from Greek drakhmē, denoting an Attic weight or coin. Compare with drachma

definitions: the basic monetary unit of Morocco and the United Arab Emirates, equal to 100 centimes in Morocco and 100 fils in the United Arab Emirates.
shortDefinitions: basic monetary unit of Morocco and United Arab Emirates, equal to 100 centimes in Morocco and 100 fils in United Arab Emirates

definitions: a monetary unit of Libya and Qatar, equal to one thousandth of a dinar in Libya and one hundredth of a riyal in Qatar.
shortDefinitions: monetary unit of Libya and Qatar, equal to one thousandth of dinar in Libya and one hundredth of riyal in Qatar
